lines.text: So this is Colton, huh? Wonder where a man can find some excitement.
You'll get your belly full of excitement. I want all your men at Sam Allen's stable come sun-up tomorrow and I want you all sober.
All right. Let's hit all the saloons and dig 'em out.
No, I got some personal business to do.
Yeah? Well, so do I. It starts with some whiskey. And if you're old enough, you what goes on from there.
Say, most of these brands you're makin' seem to be The Circle C.
Well, Circle C's got most of the cattle. The Major don't have much competition these days.
He has now. I want you to make some irons for me, Sam.
Sure thing! What brand?
The Target brand.
[draws a brand almost identical to the Circle C's]
Like that!
That brand'll make trouble, son.
I plan to make a lot of trouble for the Major.
My father told me when I was 21, I'd get the ranch. If the will says something other than that, it's a forgery.
That's a strong accusation! Can you prove it?
No.
Then I'm afraid there's no legal way for you to get the Circle C.
I thought you'd say that. A lawyer's opinion. But I'm no lawyer.
I'm moving into Newmark Valley with my own brand - The Target.
You won't be staying very long, Jet. You have no rights to Newmark.
Neither do you.
On the contrary. Hal Newmark's left Colorado. I'm taking care of the valley until he returns.
He won't return unless it's from the dead and you know it.
My lawyer calls it squatters' rights.
Tell your lawyer the Newmark has a new squatter and enough guns to keep trespassers out. And that means you, Major.
You wanna ride that horse straight up or belly down?
You didn't have to shoot him in the back!
Shoot him in the back? What are you talking about? The fellow went for his gun! I've got eight witnesses to prove it. Or maybe I've only got seven. How about it, Curly?
Oh, no, Dukey, you have eight!
Did they give you any trouble?
Naw. There was only one Circle C rider on the place. I sent him home tied to his saddle with lead for ballast.
I'll stick with Curly. I wouldn't want him to be alone when the Major finds out you killed one of his men without giving him a chance.
I got eight witnesses that prove I gave that fellow a chance!
Eight liars.
[Jet tries to help Alice recapture her canary]
Easy. Don't stampede the livestock.
[eyeing the lovely Alice]
Colton's a pretty rough town for a lone canary to be loose in.
Here's for helpin' the lady. Buy yourself a cigar.
[the Kid tosses Jet a dime]
You keep it. Until you're old enough to smoke.
[when the Kid tries to pull his pistol, Jet knocks him down]
Take it easy, Kid! You know the Major doesn't want any gunplay around Miss Alice. Get up! Get in the rig.
Maybe you'd like to try again some time - when we don't have an audience.
Any time you say. Only the second show might be a lot funnier. It'd be a shame if nobody saw it.
That lady from Virginia sure changed the Major.
Wait until the marriage and he'll get his same old even disposition back... always mad.
I don't suppose I'm the first girl you've ever kissed, but I don't care... as long as I'm the last.
But after the wedding, don't throw the flowers away. You may need them for a funeral.
You come to the wrong place, Major.
So did you, Jet.
I'll give you five minutes to get out of here.
And I'll give you five seconds to go for your gun.
I'm going home, Linton.
As easy as that. You just walked out on the man you promised to marry.
I found out you're not the man I promised to marry.
Don't try it, Jet! There's nobody that can outshoot Major Cosgrave!
Maybe another Cosgrave can.
